medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The diarrhea started approximately 1 month ago, with up to 15 stools per day, described as 'rust colored' and occasionally with small amounts of blood. The patient has diffuse lower abdominal pain, particularly in the LLQ, described as sharp/stabbing and intermittent but daily. The pain has not improved with Tramadol and tizanidine. Significant symptoms include non-bloody, non-bilious vomiting occurring two days prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hidradenitis suppurativa, diabetes mellitus, eczema, depression, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, panic attacks.
